newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Insurer seeks EU ruling on Swedish five pct rule.
newsitem.headline: Insurer seeks EU ruling on Swedish five pct rule.

text.p: Swedish insurer Skandia said on Thursday the European Court of Justice is to rule on the legality of Sweden's rule that insurance companies cannot hold more than five percent of voting rights in any one company.
Skandia said in a statement that it had been legally pursuing the question as to whether the five percent rule which applied to Swedish companies was consistent with European Union law.
Under Swedish law, there is no corresponding rule to limit a foreign insurance company's holding of shares in a Swedish company.

"Within the framework of the proceedings, the Swedish Supreme Administrative Court has now resolved to seek a preliminary ruling from the (European) Court of Justice," Skandia said. "The ruling of the (European) Court of Justice will be binding for Swedish courts of law and governmental agencies."
Skandia said it was of the opinion that the five percent rule ran counter to the EC Insurance Directives.
